data.event: The town was founded in 1875 and named New Jerusalem, California by the owner of general store who became the first postmaster in 1882.
The town was founded in 1875 and named New Jerusalem, California by the owner of general store who became the first postmaster in 1882.

event.title: 1885, a school and Santa Clara Catholic Church were built

data.event: In 1885, a school and Santa Clara Catholic Church were built.

event.title: was changed to El Rio around 1900

data.event: Located near where the coastal railroad line crosses the Santa Clara River, the town's name was changed to El Rio around 1900.
The population was 7,198 at the 2010 census, up from 6,193 at the time the 2000 census was enumerated.
